isis.stitle: POWER STEERING GEAR: SHEPPARD M-SERIES - SET RELIEF PLUNGERS - Service Procedure

svcproc.title: Service Procedure
svcproc.para: Anytime tire size or steering gears are changed, relief plunger adjustment will be necessary. A relief plunger is located in each end cap of the steering gear. One for right turn; one for left turn.

note.para: Never attempt to adjust relief plungers until axle stops are set. Refer to GROUP 02 - FRONT AXLE, General Information and Wheel Alignment section, in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for the procedure to set axle stops.

step1.para: Park the vehicle on a clean, dry, solid surface, preferably concrete. Set the parking brake and block the wheels.
Place the transmission in neutral and start the engine.
Allow the engine to operate at idle speed.

note.para: It is always best to have 2 people when setting plungers: 1 to steer the vehicle and 1 to set and check adjustments.

step1.para: Determine which plunger is used to adjust right and left turns based on direction of pitman arm travel.

Turn the steering wheel to a full left turn and check the clearance using the steel flat stock as a feeler gauge between the axle stop bolt and the axle. If the clearance is not 1/8 inch (3.2 mm), plunger adjustment will be necessary.

caution.para: If the stop bolt hits the axle under pressure, release the wheel immediately! Damage to steering components may result.

step1.para: Return the front tires to the straight ahead position and release the steering wheel. Use the screwdriver to adjust the plunger for left turn. Turning the plunger in will increase the clearance between the stop bolt and the axle, while turning the plunger out will decrease the clearance.

warning.para: Never adjust the plunger beyond flush with the end cap. Leakage or personal injury may result.

step1.para: Turn the steering wheel to a full left turn. Check the 1/8 inch (3.2 mm) clearance using the steel flat stock as a feeler gauge.

caution.para: The flat stock is used as a feeler gauge only. Do not squeeze or pinch the flat stock between the stop bolt and axle. Damage to parts may result.

step1.para: If further adjustment is required, repeat steps 7 and 8 until the 1/8 inch (3.2 mm) clearance is achieved.
Repeat steps 6 thru 9 for the right turn.
